JUSTICE SUNIL THOMAS FRIDAY, THE 5TH DAY OF JANUARY 2018 / 15TH POUSHA, 1939 Crl.MC.No. 8504 of 2017 AGAINST THE ORDER/JUDGMENT IN CC 1668/2016 of J.M.E.C.- I, OTTAPPALAM CRIME NO. 722/2016 OF SREEKRISHNAPURAM POLICE STATION , PALAKKAD PETITIONER(S)/ACCUSED NOS.1 & 2 1 ARJUN DAS, AGED 21 YEARS,S/O.SIVADASAN,PULLANTHODI HOUSE, THOTTARA,KARIMPUZHA,PALAKKAD DISTRICT. 2 HASHEER, AGED 21 YEARS,S/O MOHAMMADALI,MOTHIRAPEEDIKA HOUSE, THOTTARA,KARIMPUZHA,PALAKKAD DISTRICT. BY ADV.SRLNIREESH MATHEW RESPONDENT(S)/STATE/DEFACTO COMPLAINANT & CWi, MOTHER OF THE VICTIM: 1. STATE OF KERALA, REPRESENTED BY PUBLIC PROSECUTOR, HIGH COURT OF KERALA,ERNAKULAM-682031. 2. ABDULLA KOYA THANGAL, AGED 43 YEARS,S/O.CHERU KOYA THANGAL,PALLITHAZHATHU HOUSE, THOTTARA,KARIMPUZHA.P.O,PALAKKAD DISTRICT-679513. 3. CASE HAVING COME UP FOR ADMISSION ON 05-01-2018, THE COURT ON THE SAME DAY PASSED THE FOLLOWING: par ae Crl1.MC.No. 8504 of 2017 0 2018/KER/S04 APPENDIX PETITIONER(S)' EXHIBITS ANNEXURE A PHOTOCOPY OF THE FINAL REPORT IN CRIME NO.722/2016 OF SREEKRISHNAPURAM POLICE STATION ANNEXUREB THE ORIGINAL OF THE AFFIDAVIT SWORN TO BY THE RESPONDENT NO.2 BEFORE HIS ADVOCATE AT OTTAPALAM,DATED 5.12.2017 ANNEXURE C THE ORIGINAL OF THE AFFIDAVIT SWORN TO BY THE RESPONDENT NO.2 BEFORE HER ADVOCATE AT OTTAPALAM,DATED 5.12.2017. RESPONDENTS EXHIBITS:NIL True Copy /P A to Judge Pal SUNIL THOMAS, J. Crl.M.C.No.8504 of 2017 Dated this the 5" day of January, 2018 ORDER Petitioners stand arrayed as accused in C.C.No.1668 of 2016 of Judicial First Class Magistrate Court-I, Ottappalam arising from Crime No.722 of 2016 of Sreekrishnapuram Police Station for offences punishable under sections 119(1)(A) of the Kerala Police Act. 2. Itis alleged by the prosecution that, on 03.11.2016 at 5 p.m., accused chased the defacto complainant and abused her. Accordingly, crime was registered and after investigation, final report was filed. Crl.M.C is laid on a premise that the dispute between the parties have been completely settled to the satisfaction of the victim and the defacto complainant, who are arrayed as respondents 2 and 3. Learned counsel for respondents 2 and 3 relied on Annexures-B and C affidavits filed by them and submitted that the matter has been settled. It was acknowledged that affidavit has been filed in due settlement of the dispute between the parties. Learned Public Prosecutor submitted that the settlement between the parties have been reported to the police and the petitioners have no criminal antecedents. Dae 2018/KER/504 Cri.M.C.8504/17 2 3. Having considered the entire nature of allegations, I feel that, no purpose will be served by prosecuting the petitioners herein in the light of the settlement between the parties. Accordingly, Crl.M.C is allowed. In the result, Crl.M.C is allowed. All further proceedings in C.C.No.1668 of 2016 of Judicial First Class Magistrate Court-I, Ottappalam arising from Crime No.722 of 2016. of Sreekrishnapuram Police Station will stand quashed. Sd/- SUNIL THOMAS Judge Sbna/5/1/18 True Copy / P A to Judge
